This week in Scala (Jul 10, 2023)

2023/07/09
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Welcome to the new edition of #ThisWeekInScala! In this edition, Petr Zapletal brings you the latest news from the world of Scala and Reactive programming.

One of the highlights of this week is the release of Scala 3.1. This new version introduces several enhancements and improvements, including better support for metaprogramming and improved error messages. Developers can now take advantage of these new features to write more expressive and efficient code.

In addition to the Scala 3.1 release, this edition also covers other interesting topics such as the rise in popularity of the Akka framework for building reactive applications, and the latest updates on the Scala ecosystem.

To stay up to date with the latest news in Scala and Reactive programming, you can now subscribe to #ThisWeekInScala and receive the latest edition directly in your inbox.

println(message)
